results.title: Gospel truth
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
This episode explores the writing of the New Testament looking at the identity of Jesus Christ and his followers, his persecutors and his biographers, the Gospel writers. Also discussed is the gradual spread of Christianity throughout the Roman Empire which escalated once the Gospels became written accounts rather than spread by word of mouth.

results.title: Gosford Park
results.creator_credit: Capitol Films, Film Council, Zestwick Limited, Sandcastle 5 Productions, Bob Balaban, Robert Altman and David Levy
results.brief_description: November 1932 - Gosford Park is the magnificent Estate of the unhappily married Sir William Cordle and Lady Sylvia. Immersed in an upper-class world of frippery, fine manners and nasty natures, various friends and associates gather for a weekend shooting party; when murder occurs, suspicious ulterior motives are revealed. But this narrative, largely related from the perspective of the servants, is less of a mystery than it is a comedy centering on the politics and mores of aristocratic society, the ‘upstairs’ shenanigans of which are mirrored by the equally fascinating world of footmen, butlers, valets, maids and cooks, who vehemently adhere to the below stairs strictures. With labyrinthine systems of etiquette and appropriate behaviours, these ‘downstairs’ caretakers are bland observers of their employers’ lives, who thrive on gossip and rumour, feeding off lascivious details and intricacies, whilst observing the treachery and mixed fortunes of their masters’ lives. Presenting over a score of well-defined players, it is a testament to Altman’s skill that none are mere ciphers, but rather sustain complex characterisations, creating a fascinating tableau of class politics, societal mores, perfidious interpersonal relationships and a cohesive panorama of human behaviour. Stellar cast includes: Eileen Atkins, Bob Balaban, Alan Bates, Charles Dance, Stephen Fry, Michael Gambon, Richard E. Grant, Tom Hollander, Derek Jacobi, Kelly Macdonald, Helen Mirren, Jeremy Northam, Clive Owen, Ryan Phillippe, Maggie Smith, Kristin Scott Thomas, Emily Watson and James Wilby.

results.title: Gorky Park
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Eagle Associates, Gene Kirkwood, Howard W. Koch and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: Relentlessly thrilling from its shocking beginning to its spine-chilling end. William Hurt is a Russian Police Inspector investigating a ruthless triple murder in Moscow’s Gorky Park. The victims’ faces and fingers are missing and the KGB is trying to cover it up. Stars Lee Marvin, Brian Dennehy, Ian Bannen and introducing Joanna Pacula. Filmed entirely in Helsinki. The screenplay by Dennis Potter is based upon the novel by Martin Cruz Smith.

results.title: Gorillas in the Mist: The Story of Dian Fossey
results.creator_credit: Terence A. Clegg, Arne Glimcher, Guber-Peters Company and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of anthropologist Dian Fossey who travels to the African mountains to study the rare gorillas. Her interest in the mountain gorillas becomes an obsession and she risks her life to protect them from poachers and animal traders and ultimate extinction. Stars Sigourney Weaver and Bryan Brown.

results.title: Gorilla girls
results.creator_credit: f-reel, Film Victoria, Fiona Cochrane and Louise Hubbard
results.brief_description: A women’s basketball team, the underdog “Lady Gorilla’s”, play a win-or-die game and in doing so attack some of their personal demons. They talk and play tough because this is how life has treated them and and now with their sponsors threatening to pull the plug, the game takes on a bigger significance. They face “The Sharks” who are at the top of the ladder in what will be the game of their life.

results.title: Gorilla - Sharing a Closer Relationship
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survival Anglia Wildlife Series”.
It is not known how many gorillas are left in Africa. Possibly as many as 15,000, maybe as few as 5,000. Their natural habitat of inaccessible high altitude rain forests is being felled and cleared and the greatest of the great apes has become an endangered species. This fascinating film tells the story of one man’s struggle to protect one small population of gorillas on the slopes of Mount Kahuzi in Zaire and of his incredible relationship with Kasimir, the great silverbacked male and his family. It took Adrian Deschryver four years of daily contact and study to persuade the gorillas to let him approach closely, during which time he was charged many times by Kasimir and other senior males. They now let him move with them through the forest, watching them feed, eat and play. This is the most complete record ever obtained on film of these imposing and elusive animals. Rated: G

results.title: Gorilla
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, WQED and Barbara Jampel
results.brief_description: A film about the gorilla, a shy, gentle, intelligent creature threatened with extinction. Learn about gorilla behaviour and what is being done to save the gorilla.

results.title: Gorilla
results.creator_credit: Brian Leith, BBC and Discovery Channel
results.brief_description: Narrated by David Attenborough, this documentary follows three newly discovered colonies of Lowland Gorillas in the northern Congo, exploring the true nature of the great Ape. This film is a masterpiece of expertise and innovation, award-winning cameraman Gavin Thurston and his crew use revolutionary techniques, backed by some of the latest scientific research to reveal aspects of the gorilla’s lives that have never been seen before in their natural environment.

results.title: Gorgeous (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sharon Connolly, Film Australia and Kaz Cooke
results.brief_description: Follows the perils of cartoon character Hermoine the Modern Girl as she tackles plastic surgery, beauty therapy and bulimia, in a feral fit of inadequacy. ‘Gorgeous’ asks why men and women feel insecure and what thoughts tempt them towards eating disorders and other strange eating rituals. Hermoine proves that modern girls can stop feeling inadequate and regain their self-esteem.

results.title: Gore Vidal's Myra Breckinridge
results.creator_credit: Robert Fryer, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Michael Sarne
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Gore Vidal and directed by Michael Sarne, this film adaptation is a highly stylised and over acted parody of the Hollywood system and a surreptitious study of gender and sexual identity. Myron (Rex Reed) undergoes a sex change to become the woman he has always felt inside - Myra (Raquel Welch). Myra arrives at her Uncle Buck’s (John Huston) acting school claiming to be Myron’s widow and arguing for her half-share of the business. Uncle Buck lets her teach the weird and wonderful ‘students’ of the school while he investigates her claim with lawyers. Mae West features as an agent for leading men (“Get your resumes out boys”) resplendent in Edith Head designed costumes and satirising herself as part of the very loose plot. An absurdist take on one man’s life and sexual identity intercut throughout with some memorable and not-so memorable clips of classic Hollywood feature films and stars. Musical numbers, hippies and homosexual men get Myra though her day until it all becomes too much and her inner Myron has an run-in with a car. Cast includes Farrah Fawcett and Tom Selleck.
